00001 /** \file
00002  * \brief Attributes Table.
00003  *
00004  * See Copyright Notice in im_lib.h
00005  */
00006 
00007 #ifndef __IM_ATTRIB_H_
00008 #define __IM_ATTRIB_H_
00009 
00010 #include "im_attrib_flat.h"
00011 
00012 /** \brief Attributes Table Class
00013  *
00014  * \par
00015  * All the attributes have a name, a type, a count and the data.\n
00016  * Names are usually strings with less that 30 chars.
00017  * \par
00018  * Attributes are stored in a hash table for fast access. \n
00019  * We use the hash function described in "The Pratice of Programming" of Kernighan & Pike.
00020  * \ingroup util */
00021 class imAttribTable
00022 {
00023   imAttribTablePrivate* ptable; 
00024 public:
00025 
00026   /** Creates an empty table.
00027    * If size is zero the default size of 101 is used. Size must be a prime number. 
00028    * Other common values are 67, 599 and 1499.*/ 
00029   imAttribTable(int hash_size)
00030     { ptable = imAttribTableCreate(hash_size); }
00031 
00032   /** Destroys the table and all the attributes. */
00033   ~imAttribTable()
00034     { imAttribTableDestroy(ptable); ptable = 0; }
00035 
00036   /** Returns the number of elements in the table. */
00037   int Count() const
00038     { return imAttribTableCount(ptable); }
00039 
00040   /** Removes all the attributes in the table */
00041   void RemoveAll()
00042     { imAttribTableRemoveAll(ptable); }
00043 
00044   /** Copies the contents of the given table into this table. */
00045   void CopyFrom(const imAttribTable& table)
00046     { imAttribTableCopyFrom(ptable, table.ptable); }
00047 
00048   /** Merges the contents of the given table into this table. */
00049   void MergeFrom(const imAttribTable& table)
00050     { imAttribTableMergeFrom(ptable, table.ptable); }
00051 
00052   /** Inserts an attribute into the table. \n 
00053    * If data_type is BYTE then count can be -1 to indicate a NULL terminated string.
00054    * Data is duplicated if not NULL, else data is initialized with zeros.
00055    * See also \ref imDataType. */
00056   void Set(const char* name, int data_type, int count, const void* data)
00057     { imAttribTableSet(ptable, name, data_type, count, data); }
00058 
00059   /** Removes an attribute from the table given its name. */
00060   void UnSet(const char *name)
00061     { imAttribTableUnSet(ptable, name); }
00062 
00063   /** Finds an attribute in the table.
00064    * Returns the attribute if found, NULL otherwise. 
00065    * See also \ref imDataType. */
00066   const void* Get(const char *name, int *data_type = 0, int *count = 0) const
00067     { return imAttribTableGet(ptable, name, data_type, count); }
00068 
00069   /** For each attribute calls the user callback. If the callback returns 0 the function returns. */
00070   void ForEach(void* user_data, imAttribTableCallback attrib_func) const
00071     { imAttribTableForEach(ptable, user_data, attrib_func); }
00072 };
00073 
00074 /** \brief Attributes Array Class
00075  *
00076  * \par
00077  * Same as \ref imAttribTable, but uses an array of fixed size.
00078  * \ingroup util */
00079 class imAttribArray
00080 {
00081   imAttribTablePrivate* ptable; 
00082 public:
00083 
00084   /** Creates an empty array. */ 
00085   imAttribArray(int count)
00086     { ptable = imAttribArrayCreate(count); }
00087 
00088   /** Destroys the array and all the attributes. */
00089   ~imAttribArray()
00090     { imAttribTableDestroy(ptable); ptable = 0; }
00091 
00092   /** Returns the number of elements in the array. */
00093   int Count() const
00094     { return imAttribTableCount(ptable); }
00095 
00096   /** Removes all the attributes in the array */
00097   void RemoveAll()
00098     { imAttribTableRemoveAll(ptable); }
00099 
00100   /** Copies the contents of the given table into this table. */
00101   void CopyFrom(const imAttribArray& table)
00102     { imAttribArrayCopyFrom(ptable, table.ptable); }
00103 
00104   /** Inserts one attribute into the array. 
00105    * The attribute data is a simple array of data_type elements of count length. \n 
00106    * Data is duplicated if not NULL, else data is initialized with zeros. 
00107    * When NULL is specified use the Get method to retrieve a pointer to the data 
00108    * so you can initialize it with other values.
00109    * See also \ref imDataType. */
00110   void Set(int index, const char* name, int data_type, int count, const void* data)
00111     { imAttribArraySet(ptable, index, name, data_type, count, data); }
00112 
00113   /** Finds one attribute in the array.
00114    * Returns the attribute if found, NULL otherwise.
00115    * See also \ref imDataType. */
00116   const void* Get(int index, char *name = 0, int *data_type = 0, int *count = 0) const
00117     { return imAttribArrayGet(ptable, index, name, data_type, count); }
00118 
00119   /** For each attribute calls the user callback. If the callback returns 0 the function returns. */
00120   void ForEach(void* user_data, imAttribTableCallback attrib_func) const
00121     { imAttribTableForEach(ptable, user_data, attrib_func); }
00122 };
00123 
00124 #endif
